You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Allow a Buyer to Manage Their Carts on the My Account Page

Provide a buyer with options for managing all the cart records they're entitled to access.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To access CC Admin and change settings:	Access B2B Commerce for Visualforce Admin Settings permission set

You can configure the following parts of the My Carts section of the My Account page:

Whether the My Carts section is available in the My Account page menu (1).
How the My Carts section filters the list of cart records shown (2):
Show cart records where the User field matches the current buyer's user ID
Show cart records where the Owner field matches the current buyer's user ID
TIP For a simple scenario where a buyer creates their own cart, selecting either field doesn't affect the buyer's experience. The cart record's User and Owner fields are both set to the buyer's user ID. For more complicated scenarios, such as logging in with an effective account, perhaps you want to ensure that only certain cart records are available.

Each cart listed in the My Carts section provides the following non-configurable options:

The cart name (3), which navigates to the Shopping Cart page for showing the cart's items and quantities.
Clone button (4), which creates another cart record for the current buyer, based on the items and quantities of the selected cart.
NOTE In B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13) or later, you can specify whether the new cart becomes active and priced after it's created. See Specify Whether to Activate and Price a Cloned Cart.
Rename button (5), which opens a window where the buyer can specify a new name for the selected cart.
Delete button (6), which removes the selected cart.

To configure the user experience of the My Carts section, update your storefront configuration settings.

Verify that the My Carts section is available in the My Account page menu.
On the CC Admin tab in your org, select your storefront (1).
In the Storefront Settings menu, select Configuration Settings (2).
From the Module picklist, select My Account Navigation Bar (3).
Find the Show My Carts configuration (4), and make sure that its value is TRUE (5).
TIP
If the value is FALSE, click Override in the Action column. Enter TRUE for Value, and click Create.
If the configuration doesn't exist, click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	My Account Navigation Bar
Configuration	Show My Carts
Page	all
Value	TRUE
Specify the data source for the list of carts shown on the page.
From the Module picklist, select Cart (6).
Find the Filter By User configuration (7), and check its value (8).
TIP
To show cart records where the User field matches the current buyer's user ID, use TRUE.
To show cart records where the Owner field matches the current buyer's user ID, use FALSE.
If the configuration doesn't exist, click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	Cart
Configuration	Filter By User
Page	all
Value	TRUE or FALSE
Build and activate a new configuration cache.

title: Managing Buyers' Carts on the My Account Page
